Never saw the first one--because seeing the second one was--imho--one of the worst wastes of movie ticket money I've ever had the misfortune to spend--turned me OFF from watching ANY Gene Hackman movie for a good 20 years--in fact, the first Gene Hackman movie I have been able to stomach is The Quick and the Dead--and that only because of Sharon Stone's character.  I can still hear him saying to some minor French perp (who didn't understand any English) that he was going to stomp his leg into oatmeal!
Just goes to show--that beauty is in the eyes of the beholder!

Can I say something about?

If I am asked about selection of movies I encode, I have learned long ago that some movies doesn't stand "test of time".

And that is basic difference between approach of both trikiti and azrielle. Trikiti have put the movie in his perspective, and that perspective is both ultimately personal (we cannot know what movies he like) and perspective is "younger" some twenty years plus, meaning that azrielle's "judgment" was established long ago and needles to say, as such should be placed in his personal context, which might be strange to trikiti, so should be vice-versa, but the fact is - individual standards and metrics are very often enigmatic for any other person who doesn't have nor share background, age and mind-set. I also must point the language - what  seems as perfectly acceptable for non-native English speakers, might sound as ultimately ridiculous for native speaker (as azrielle) because native speaker put sayings from the screen in real-life context.
